ground_truth: He saunters up to her as she takes another drag on her cigarette. Charlie grins, reaches in her overall pocket, and takes out a pack, holding it out for him to take one. He points at his map, and Jeep sees them while holding an old wooden cot, stares at them, then walks away. Charlie puffs on her cigarette. In the diner, Audrey sits alone as Sandra squeezes cream into Howard's cupped hand, and he rubs it in. Charlie leads a tall, black, 30'ish Kyle inside, and Audrey looks up with interest. Kyle glances at the other three diners, then follows Charlie to the counter, all eyes on him. The scruffy, unshaven Bob tilts his head to one side. In the garage, Jeep is cleaning the cot, and Bob strides over, sees the old cot on a bench, and stares at his son. They're outside as Jeep glares at his father, who shakes his head. Jeep looks down and away from Bob, then glances at his father, who screws up his eyes, and Jeep lowers his eyes. Bob pats him affectionately on the cheek, and Jeep watches his father go. As Bob enters the diner, Howard turns to him, and Bob holds his thumb and forefinger close together. He sees static on the television screen, and outside, Jeep's attention is drawn to something down the road. Jeep steps forward and glances at the horizon, where an anomalous-growing dark cloud fills it. Inside, Bob steps up on a chair to examine the TV set, while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, finding another encroaching black cloud dominating the horizon there. Others look at the screen, and Kyle proffers money. Percy switches on a radio and tries tuning it in, as Charlie's eyes venture to the TV. Sandra gets to her feet, and all six of them are still as they stare at the TV, four standing, with Audrey and Howard sitting. Kyle is on the phone in the back and removes his hat when Bob had switched off the television. In the garage, Jeep is looking at the apparently pristine top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake, feeling hopeless. An old white Ford Sedan turns off the road and heads towards the petrol pumps, passes them, and draws to a halt outside the diner. The driver's door opens, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are plunked on the rocky ground as an elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan emerges from the car, walks a little, then shuts the door. Jeep looks curiously around as the old woman's shadow is cast on the diner door. She opens the door and shuffles in with the aid of the Zimmer, and Kyle and Percy glance around. Charlie spots her as Audrey glances up at the old woman, who grins and looks over at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He strolls up to her as she takes another drag on her cigarette. Charlie smirks, reaches in her overall pocket, and extracts a pack, extending it out for him to take one. He gestures at his chart, and Jeep observes them while clutching an aged wooden cot, gazes at them, then ambles away. Charlie exhales on her cigarette. In the diner, Audrey sits alone as Sandra squeezes cream into Howard's cupped hand, and he massages it in. Charlie guides a tall, black, 30'ish Kyle inside, and Audrey glances up with interest. Kyle surveys the other three diners, then follows Charlie to the counter, all eyes on him. The scruffy, unshaven Bob inclines his head to one side. In the garage, Jeep is scrubbing the cot, and Bob strides over, observes the old cot on a bench, and gazes at his son. They're outside as Jeep glowers at his father, who shakes his head. Jeep looks down and away from Bob, then glances at his father, who squints, and Jeep lowers his eyes. Bob pats him fondly on the cheek, and Jeep watches his father depart. As Bob enters the diner, Howard turns to him, and Bob holds his thumb and forefinger close together. He sees static on the television monitor, and outside, Jeep's attention is drawn to something down the road. Jeep steps forward and glances at the horizon, where an unusual-growing dark cloud fills it. Inside, Bob steps up on a chair to inspect the TV set, while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, discovering another encroaching black cloud dominating the horizon there. Others look at the screen, and Kyle offers cash. Percy switches on a radio and tries tuning it in, as Charlie's eyes wander to the TV. Sandra gets to her feet, and all six of them are still as they gaze at the TV, four standing, with Audrey and Howard seated. Kyle is on the phone in the back and removes his hat when Bob had switched off the television. In the garage, Jeep is inspecting the seemingly spotless top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake, feeling despondent. An old white Ford Sedan turns off the road and heads towards the petrol pumps, passes them, and draws to a stop outside the diner. The driver's door opens, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are placed on the rocky ground as an elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan emerges from the car, walks a little, then shuts the door. Jeep looks curiously around as the old woman's shadow is cast on the diner door. She opens the door and shuffles in with the aid of the Zimmer, and Kyle and Percy glance around. Charlie spots her as Audrey glances up at the old woman, who beams and looks over at Howard and Sandra.

In the garage, the apparently pristine top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake are being looked at by Jeep, feeling hopeless. An old white Ford Sedan is turned off the road, heads towards the petrol pumps, passes them, and to a halt outside the diner, it is drawn. The driver's door is opened, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are plunked on the rocky ground by an elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan, who emerges from the car, walks a little, then shuts the door. A curious look is given around by Jeep as the diner door is cast with the old woman's shadow. The door is opened by her, and she shuffles in with the aid of the Zimmer, and Kyle and Percy glance around. The old woman is spotted by Charlie as Audrey glances up at her, who grins and looks over at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He saunters over as she takes a drag on her cigarette. Charlie grins, pulls a pack from her overall pocket, and offers him one. He points at his map as Jeep, holding an old wooden cot, observes them and walks away. Charlie puffs on her cigarette. In the diner, Audrey sits alone while Sandra squeezes cream into Howard's hand, which he rubs in. Charlie leads a tall, black, 30'ish Kyle inside, catching Audrey's interest. Kyle glances at the other diners before following Charlie to the counter, drawing attention. Bob, scruffy and unshaven, tilts his head. In the garage, Jeep cleans the cot. Bob approaches, sees the old cot, and stares at Jeep. Outside, Jeep glares at his father, who shakes his head. Jeep looks away, then back at Bob, who squints before patting Jeep's cheek affectionately. Jeep watches Bob leave. In the diner, Howard turns to Bob, who gestures with thumb and forefinger. Bob sees static on the TV as Jeep's focus shifts to a dark cloud on the horizon. Bob examines the TV, while Jeep notices another cloud. Others watch the screen as Kyle offers money. Percy turns on a radio, and Charlie looks at the TV. Sandra stands, and all six are still, with Audrey and Howard seated. Kyle is on the phone when Bob switches off the TV. In the garage, Jeep examines the pristine Beamer engine, feeling hopeless. An old white Ford Sedan stops outside the diner. An elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan exits, using her Zimmer frame. Jeep watches her shadow on the diner door. She enters, and Kyle and Percy look around as Charlie spots her. Audrey glances at the grinning old woman, who looks at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: He approaches her as she smokes. Charlie grins, fetches a pack from her pocket, offering him one. He points at his map, while Jeep, holding an old cot, stares and walks away. Charlie smokes. In the diner, Audrey sits alone; Sandra applies cream to Howardâ€™s hand. Charlie leads tall, black Kyle inside; Audrey is intrigued. Kyle notices the other diners and follows Charlie. Scruffy Bob tilts his head. In the garage, Jeep cleans the cot as Bob stares at him. Outside, Jeep glares at Bob, who shakes his head. Bob pats Jeepâ€™s cheek affectionately; Jeep watches him leave. Bob enters the diner and gestures to Howard, noticing the static on the TV. Outside, Jeep sees a dark cloud on the horizon. An elderly woman with white hair exits, using a Zimmer frame. Jeep watches her shadow as she enters. Charlie sees her, and Audrey looks up at the smiling woman who glances at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As he leisurely approaches her, she takes yet another slow drag from her cigarette, savoring each moment. With a broad grin, Charlie reaches into her overall pocket and retrieves a pack of cigarettes, holding it out invitingly for him to take one. He gestures toward his map, and Jeep, who is preoccupied with holding an aged wooden cot, notices them from a distance. He stares for a moment before deciding to walk away. Meanwhile, Charlie inhales deeply on her cigarette, enjoying the familiar sensation. Inside the diner, Audrey is seated all by herself, while Sandra is busy squeezing some cream into Howard's open hand, which he carefully rubs into his skin. Charlie, leading a tall, black man in his thirties named Kyle, enters the diner, causing Audrey to look up with intrigue and curiosity. Kyle briefly glances at the trio of other diners before following Charlie to the counter, aware of all the attention focused on him. The scruffy and unshaven Bob tilts his head to one side, observing them. Over in the garage, Jeep is diligently cleaning the cot, and Bob strides over, noticing the old cot placed on the bench, and then gazes intently at his son. Outside, tensions rise as Jeep glares at his father, who merely shakes his head in response. Jeep averts his eyes, looking down and then back up at his father, who narrows his eyes in disapproval, prompting Jeep to lower his gaze once more. Bob affectionately pats his son on the cheek, and Jeep watches silently as his father walks away. As Bob steps into the diner, Howard turns his attention to him, and Bob makes a small gesture with his thumb and forefinger close together. He notices the static on the television screen, while, outside, something down the road catches Jeep's attention. He steps forward, directing his gaze to the horizon, where an ominous, ever-growing dark cloud now fills the sky. Inside, Bob climbs onto a chair to take a closer look at the TV set, while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, noticing another encroaching black cloud that is beginning to dominate the sky there. The other patrons turn their attention to the screen, and Kyle offers some money. Percy switches on a radio, fiddling with the knobs in an attempt to tune it in, as Charlie's eyes drift toward the television. Sandra stands up, and the six of them remain frozen in place, focused intently on the TV, with four standing, while Audrey and Howard remain seated. Kyle is on the phone in the back and removes his hat when Bob turns off the television. Over in the garage, Jeep finds himself staring hopelessly at the seemingly immaculate top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake. An old white Ford Sedan veers off the road, makes its way to the petrol pumps, passes them, and comes to a stop just outside the diner. The driver's door opens, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are placed down on the rocky ground as an elderly woman with white hair wearing a pink cardigan steps out of the car, takes a few steps, and closes the door behind her. Jeep glances around with curiosity as the old woman's shadow falls across the diner's door. She opens the door and, with the aid of her Zimmer frame, shuffles inside. Kyle and Percy both glance in her direction. Charlie notices her, and Audrey looks up at the elderly woman, who greets them with a grin and then turns her gaze affectionately toward Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As he leisurely makes his way toward her, she takes yet another slow, deliberate drag from her cigarette, savoring every single moment. With a broad, welcoming grin, Charlie casually reaches into her overall pocket, retrieving a pack of cigarettes, and holds it out in an inviting manner for him to take one. He gestures animatedly toward his map, and Jeep, who is currently occupied with holding onto an old, weathered wooden cot, notices them from afar. He stares momentarily before making the decision to walk away. Meanwhile, Charlie inhales deeply on her cigarette, relishing the familiar sensation it provides. Inside the cozy diner, Audrey finds herself seated all alone, while Sandra busily squeezes cream into Howard's open hand, which he then methodically rubs into his skin. At that moment, Charlie, leading a tall, imposing black man in his thirties named Kyle, enters the diner, causing Audrey to glance up with both intrigue and curiosity. Kyle briefly casts a glance at the trio of other diners before he follows Charlie to the counter, fully aware of the attention focused on him. The scruffy, unshaven Bob tilts his head to one side, intently observing them. Meanwhile, over in the garage, Jeep is diligently cleaning the cot, while Bob strides over, noticing the old cot placed on the bench, and then gazes intently at his son. Outside, tensions rise as Jeep glares at his father, who merely responds by shaking his head. Jeep averts his eyes, glancing down and then back up at his father, who narrows his eyes in disapproval, prompting Jeep to lower his gaze once more. Bob affectionately pats his son on the cheek, and Jeep watches silently as his father walks away. As Bob steps into the diner, Howard turns his attention to him, and Bob makes a small gesture with his thumb and forefinger, held close together. He notices the static buzzing on the television screen, while outside, something in the distance catches Jeep's attention. Jeep steps forward, directing his gaze toward the horizon, where an ominous, ever-expanding dark cloud now fills the vast sky. Inside, Bob climbs onto a chair to take a closer look at the TV set, while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, noticing yet another encroaching black cloud that is beginning to dominate the sky there. The other patrons turn their attention to the screen, and Kyle offers some money. Percy switches on a radio, fiddling with the knobs in an attempt to tune it in, as Charlie's eyes slowly drift toward the television. Sandra stands up, and the six of them remain frozen in place, concentrating intently on the TV, with four standing, while Audrey and Howard stay seated. Kyle is on the phone in the back and respectfully removes his hat when Bob decides to turn off the television. Over in the garage, Jeep finds himself hopelessly staring at the seemingly immaculate top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake. An old white Ford Sedan suddenly veers off the road, makes its way to the petrol pumps, passes them carefully, and comes to a stop just outside the diner. The driver's door opens, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are placed down on the rocky, uneven ground as an elderly woman with white hair, wearing a pink cardigan, steps out of the car, takes a few measured steps, and closes the door behind her. Jeep glances around with curiosity as the old woman's shadow stretches across the diner's door. She opens the door and, with the aid of her Zimmer frame, shuffles her way inside. Kyle and Percy both glance in her direction. Charlie notices her, and Audrey looks up at the elderly woman, who greets them with a warm grin and then turns her gaze affectionately toward Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He casually strolls towards her as she leisurely inhales from her cigarette, emitting a thin stream of smoke. Charlie, with a mischievous grin, slips her hand into her overall pocket, retrieves a pack of cigarettes, and extends it toward him in a silent offer, allowing him to take one. He gestures toward his map, catching Jeep's attention, who, while clutching an old wooden cot, pauses to stare at them with a keen gaze before deciding to saunter away. Charlie inhales deeply, savoring her cigarette. Meanwhile, in the cozy confines of the diner, Audrey sits in solitude as Sandra deftly squirts cream into Howard's waiting, cupped hand, watching as he carefully massages it into his skin. Charlie confidently leads a tall, black man in his thirties, named Kyle, through the diner's entrance, causing Audrey to glance up with newfound interest. Kyle takes a moment to survey the other three diners, absorbing the scene, before trailing behind Charlie to the counter, aware that all eyes are fixed on him. Bob, unkempt and unshaven, tilts his head thoughtfully to the side. In a nearby garage, Jeep diligently cleans the old cot when Bob strides over, noticing the cot resting on a bench, and fixes his gaze on his son with a wordless expression. As they stand outside, Jeep's eyes narrow as he casts a resentful look at his father, who responds with a resigned shake of his head. Jeep momentarily averts his gaze downward before looking back at his father, who squints in return, prompting Jeep to lower his eyes again. In a tender gesture, Bob affectionately pats Jeep on the cheek, leaving Jeep to watch his father walk away. As Bob steps into the diner, Howard turns his attention to him while Bob deftly pinches his thumb and forefinger close together. He notices the television screen flickering with static as Jeep's attention shifts outside to something in the distance. Jeep steps forward, squinting toward the horizon, where a peculiarly expanding dark cloud engulfs it. Inside, Bob climbs onto a chair to scrutinize the malfunctioning TV set while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, spotting another ominous black cloud filling the horizon. Others in the diner turn their focus to the screen as Kyle offers up some money. Percy fiddles with the radio, turning it on and attempting to tune into a station, while Charlie's eyes drift toward the television. Sandra rises to her feet, and the six of them, standing silently, are captivated by what the TV reveals, with Audrey and Howard remaining seated. Kyle retreats to the back, speaking on the phone, and respectfully removes his hat as Bob switches off the TV. In the garage once more, Jeep examines the seemingly immaculate engine block and air intake of the Beamer with a sense of despair. An elderly white Ford Sedan slowly veers off the road, heading toward the petrol pumps, bypasses them, and finally comes to a stop in front of the diner. The driver's door swings open, and the wheels and supports of a Zimmer frame clatter onto the rocky ground as an elderly woman with wispy white hair and a pink cardigan emerges, taking a few tentative steps before closing the car door. Jeep, curious, glances around as the shadow of the old woman casts itself upon the diner's door. She pushes the door open and shuffles inside with the aid of her Zimmer frame, drawing the attention of Kyle and Percy as they look her way. Charlie notices the woman's entrance as Audrey lifts her gaze to see the elderly woman, who greets her with a broad grin and directs her attention toward Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: He approaches her as she smokes, and Charlie grins while retrieving a cigarette pack from her overall pocket, offering it to him. He gestures to his map, catching Jeep's attention as he carries an old wooden cot, momentarily observes them, and then departs. Inside the diner, Audrey sits alone as Sandra applies cream to Howard's hands. Charlie leads Kyle, a tall Black man in his thirties, into the diner, drawing Audrey's interest. Kyle scans the other diners before joining Charlie at the counter under everyone's watchful eyes. Bob, unshaven and scruffy, notices Kyle and tilts his head. Elsewhere, Jeep cleans the cot as Bob approaches, sees it on the bench, and silently observes his son. Outside, Jeep confronts Bob with a glare, but Bob's disapproving shake of the head causes Jeep to look away. Bob affectionately pats Jeep's cheek before leaving, and Jeep watches him go. When Bob enters the diner, he gestures to Howard about the TV's static, drawing Jeep's attention outside to an ominous dark cloud on the horizon. Bob steps onto a chair to check the TV while Jeep notices another dark cloud in the opposite direction. Inside, Kyle offers money as Percy switches on the radio, and the group, now transfixed by the TV, includes Sandra standing up while Audrey and Howard remain seated. In the back, Kyle removes his hat and uses the phone as Bob turns off the TV. Meanwhile, in the garage, Jeep, feeling hopeless, inspects the pristine-looking Beamer engine. An old white Ford Sedan pulls up to the petrol pumps, stopping outside the diner. An elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan exits the car with a Zimmer frame. Her shadow looms on the diner's door as she enters, capturing the attention of Charlie, Kyle, Percy, and Audrey, while the old woman smiles and glances at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He saunters up to her as she takes another drag on her cigarette, which is a habit that has become less common due to increasing health awareness and smoking bans in public places. Charlie grins, reaches in her overall pocket, and takes out a pack of Lucky Strikes, a brand that gained fame in the 20th century for its catchy advertising slogans, holding it out for him to take one. He points at his map, an old and worn paper map that has seen many adventures and detours, and Jeep, who often tinkers with old vehicles in the garage, sees them while holding an old wooden cot, a relic from his grandfather's era, stares at them, then walks away. Charlie puffs on her cigarette. In the diner, a classic American eatery known for its pie, Audrey sits alone as Sandra squeezes cream into Howard's cupped hand, and he rubs it in, a remedy for his perpetually dry skin from the harsh desert air. Charlie leads a tall, black, 30'ish Kyle inside, recently arrived from the bustling city life he left behind, and Audrey looks up with interest. Kyle glances at the other three diners, then follows Charlie to the counter, all eyes on him as new faces are rare in this quiet town. The scruffy, unshaven Bob tilts his head to one side, unconsciously mimicking a detective sizing up a suspect. In the garage, Jeep is cleaning the cot, a task he finds strangely meditative, and Bob strides over, sees the old cot on a bench, and stares at his son, contemplating his choices. They're outside as Jeep glares at his father, who shakes his head, an unspoken dialogue of disappointment. Jeep looks down and away from Bob, then glances at his father, who screws up his eyes as if trying to read something obscured, and Jeep lowers his eyes. Bob pats him affectionately on the cheek, a rare gesture of paternal warmth, and Jeep watches his father go. As Bob enters the diner, Howard turns to him, and Bob holds his thumb and forefinger close together, indicating something small or insignificant that only they understand. He sees static on the television screen, a reminder of the dinerâ€™s outdated technology, and outside, Jeep's attention is drawn to something down the road. Jeep steps forward and glances at the horizon, where an anomalous-growing dark cloud, unusual in the normally clear skies of this region, fills it. Inside, Bob steps up on a chair to examine the TV set, an old cathode-ray model that has been in the diner since Bob was a young man, while Jeep looks in the opposite direction, finding another encroaching black cloud dominating the horizon there. Others look at the screen, and Kyle proffers money, perhaps to settle his tab as he plans to leave soon. Percy switches on a radio and tries tuning it in, hoping to catch any news on the strange weather, as Charlie's eyes venture to the TV. Sandra gets to her feet, and all six of them are still as they stare at the TV, four standing, with Audrey and Howard sitting, transfixed by the unfolding mystery. Kyle is on the phone in the back, trying to reach someone in the city where communication is more reliable, and removes his hat when Bob had switched off the television, a sign of respect for the unfolding situation. In the garage, Jeep is looking at the apparently pristine top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake, feeling hopeless about getting it to run smoothly. An old white Ford Sedan, reminiscent of the classic models popular in the mid-20th century, turns off the road and heads towards the petrol pumps, passes them, and draws to a halt outside the diner. The driver's door opens, and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame, a mobility aid for those who have difficulty walking, are plunked on the rocky ground as an elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan, a cheery splash of color against the muted landscape, emerges from the car, walks a little, then shuts the door. Jeep looks curiously around as the old woman's shadow is cast on the diner door. She opens the door and shuffles in with the aid of the Zimmer, and Kyle and Percy glance around, noting her as an unexpected visitor. Charlie spots her as Audrey glances up at the old woman, who grins, her face lined with the stories of a lifetime, and looks over at Howard and Sandra, perhaps recognizing them from days long past.

Charlie spots her as Audrey glances up at the old woman who grins and looks over at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He saunters up to her as she takes another drag on her cigarette. Charlie grins reaches in her overall pocket and takes out a pack holding it out for him to take one. He points at his map and Jeep sees them while holding an old wooden cot stares at them then walks away. Charlie puffs on her cigarette. In the diner Audrey sits alone as Sandra squeezes cream into Howard's cupped hand and he rubs it in. Charlie leads a tall black 30'ish Kyle inside and Audrey looks up with interest. Kyle glances at the other three diners then follows Charlie to the counter all eyes on him. The scruffy unshaven Bob tilts his head to one side. In the garage Jeep is cleaning the cot and Bob strides over sees the old cot on a bench and stares at his son. They are outside as Jeep glares at his father who shakes his head. Jeep looks down and away from Bob then glances at his father who screws up his eyes and Jeep lowers his eyes. Bob pats him affectionately on the cheek and Jeep watches his father go. As Bob enters the diner Howard turns to him and Bob holds his thumb and forefinger close together. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. He sees static on the television screen and outside. Jeep's attention is drawn to something down the road. Jeep steps forward and glances at the horizon where an anomalousgrowing dark cloud fills it. Inside Bob steps up on a chair to examine the TV set while Jeep looks in the opposite direction finding another encroaching black cloud dominating the horizon there. Others look at the screen and Kyle proffers money. Percy switches on a radio and tries tuning it in as Charlie's eyes venture to the TV. Sandra gets to her feet and all six of them are still as they stare at the TV four standing with Audrey and Howard sitting. Kyle is on the phone in the back and removes his hat when Bob had switched off the television. In the garage Jeep is looking at the apparently pristine top of the Beamer's engine block and its air intake feeling hopeless. An old white Ford Sedan turns off the road and heads towards the petrol pumps passes them and draws to a halt outside the diner. The driver's door opens and the wheels and stanchions of a Zimmer frame are plunked on the rocky ground as an elderly woman with white hair and a pink cardigan emerges from the car walks a little then shuts the door. Jeep looks curiously around as the old woman's shadow is cast on the diner door. She opens the door and shuffles in with the aid of the Zimmer and Kyle and Percy glance around. Charlie spots her as Audrey glances up at the old woman who grins and looks over at Howard and Sandra.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The rabbit hops up to the owl as it paints another stroke on its canvas. Brian smirks, reaches into its backpack pocket, and takes out a book, holding it out for the rabbit to toss one. The rabbit points at its compass, and Falcon sees them while holding an old rusty lantern, glances at them, then glides away. Brian scribbles on its canvas. In the library, Vivian sits alone as Tina pours sugar into Alex's large cup, and he sips it up. Brian guides a short, gray, 20'ish Jordan inside, and Vivian peeks up with curiosity. Jordan peers at the other three patrons, then trails Brian to the bookshelf, all eyes on it. The dusty, bearded Frank tilts his head to the side. In the workshop, Falcon is scrubbing the lantern, and Frank strides over, notices the aged lantern on a shelf, and glares at his cousin. They're outside as Falcon squints at his cousin, who nods his head. Falcon glances down and away from Frank, then peeks at his cousin, who closes his eyes, and Falcon lowers his gaze. Frank pets it warmly on the shoulder, and Falcon observes his cousin depart. As Frank steps into the library, Alex turns to him, and Frank holds his palm and fingers extended wide apart. He hears music on the radio, and outside, Falcon's focus is drawn to something down the hill. Falcon leaps forward and gazes at the skyline, where a massive-floating white balloon fills it. Inside, Frank climbs up on a ladder to inspect the lamp, while Falcon looks in the opposite direction, noticing another rising white balloon consuming the skyline there. Others listen to the music, and Jordan offers coins. Quincy turns on a fan and attempts lowering it down, as Brian's eyes wander to the lamp. Tina rises from her perch, and all six of them pause as they listen to the fan, four standing, with Vivian and Alex sitting. Jordan is on the microphone in the back and removes its cap when Frank had turned off the fan. In the workshop, Falcon is staring at the apparently shiny side of the truck's wheel hub and its brake pad, feeling determined. An old black Jeep Wrangler veers off the path and navigates towards the oak trees, bypasses them, and stops beside the library. The passenger door opens, and the wings and frame of a kite are placed on the grassy field as a youthful man with black hair and a red jacket emerges from the vehicle, strolls a bit, then closes the door. Falcon peers inquisitively around as the youthful man's shadow is projected on the library entrance. He pulls the door and saunters in with the help of the kite, and Jordan and Quincy swivel around. Brian notices him as Vivian looks up at the youthful man, who beams and glances over at Alex and Tina.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Charlie, with a cigarette pack, greets a man holding a map as Jeep watches and walks away with an old cot. In a diner, Audrey observes Sandra and Howard while Charlie brings in Kyle, attracting attention. Jeep and his father, Bob, share a tense moment outside. Bob enters the diner, gestures at static on the TV, and Jeep notices dark clouds on the horizon. Inside, everyone watches the TV, while Kyle is on the phone. Jeep, feeling despondent, inspects a car engine. An elderly woman arrives in a Ford Sedan, enters the diner with her Zimmer frame, catching the group's attention as they turn to watch her.
